title: What the uninspiring DJI Air 3 says about the drone industry
description: Its true, all of the rumors have been true. The new $1,099 (and up) DJI Air 3 drone has two cameras, 46 minutes of battery life, improved connectivity with Occusync 4, a brand-new controller, and a brand-new design resembling the recently released Mavic 3 and Mavic 3 Pro. But is it enough to make me want to buy it? #drone #drones #technology   Read more:   0:01 Intro and my concern 1:17 Image quality, sensor size, dual camera system, photos 1:40 Low light performance 1:53 3x telephoto lens 2:24 One tiny problem with the second lens 3:25 What else is new? DJI RC 2, Ocusync 4, battery 4:08 Color space (D-Log M), noise level, slow motion, night mode 4:55 Status Update: Drone innovation is slowing down  5:52 DJI is getting complacent  6:46 2.7K vertical mode  7:05 Whats next?  7:29 DJIs comptition (Autel, Skydio)  8:55 Chasing storms  (and should you buy it?) 9:46 My plea to DJI    Subscribe:  Like The Verge on Facebook:  Follow on Twitter:  Follow on Instagram:  Follow on TikTok:   The Vergecast Podcast:  Decoder with Nilay Patel:   More about our podcasts:   Read More:  Community guidelines:  Wallpapers from The Verge:   Subscribe to The Vergecast on YouTube, new episodes on Wednesday and Friday:
